website_summaries.verdict: The 2017 Nvidia Shield is better than ever, and the addition of Amazon finally makes it a viable high-end alternative to Roku.
pros: The 2017 Nvidia Shield Android TV streaming box offers just about every must-have app, including Amazon Video, and many include 4K along with HDR
It's a versatile gaming platform with an improved controller
Voice search and interactivity, from controller or remote, work well
cons: Not as many 4K and HDR apps as Roku, and no access to first-tier games without streaming from a PC

customer_reviews.title: Hindsight is better than foresight;
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this more than five stars I would. I have had a Firestick and an H96 Pro Plus before this and I was beginning to think that streaming was not going to be a good way to see movies. They stopped while playing and generally did not work well. The Shield is like driving a Ferrari after driving a Pinto. It is unbelievably fast and works perfectly. Don't waste your money buying the others just because they are cheaper. The Shield is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bond

customer_reviews.title: Overrated, Lags and Spam....
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to pick up a shield for streaming based on reviews and specs but it has been far from perfect. The User Interface is not easy to navigate and the performance has been subpar. Like most other Big Name products its limited and loaded with bloatware. Tryimg to stream TV and it lags, looks terrible and worst of all... I have Ad Popups. Seriously?! I just missed the return window and will be glad to unload this and pick up another Android Box.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE IN THE WORLD
customer_reviews.text: THE SHIELD IS EXCELLENT, BUT THE REMOTE IS A PIECE OF CRAP. IT DIDN'T SURVIVE MY FIRST BATTERY CHANGE, AND I'M BEING GIVEN THE RUN-AROUND REGARDING A REPLACEMENT. I WILL UPDATE.
customer_reviews.author: ROOSEVELT STRANGE

customer_reviews.title: Its amazing, very fast and 4K looks great on it
customer_reviews.text: It's the best for streaming, I use terrarium tv and love it. No issues at all. I also purchased a second one for my dad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Clark

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this if you are wanting a simple multimedia system.
customer_reviews.text: I had a defective device, after 7 hours of of negotiations they requested a serial number which is only visible under a 20x microscope. if you are looking for something to watch Netflix, Amazon Prime or Slang it's simply not worth the bother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great media player for Netflix and Kodi
customer_reviews.text: Definitively the best player I ever owned. I also own a Minix (high quality and performance too) but the Netflix compatibility feature makes the ultimate difference in terms of overall value. I did not buy the kit with game remote controller, but probably it’s another plus of this player. AAA titles available (some of them for free) are a real plus for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Falzone

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Not a good streaming device. I have already replaced the remote control that came with it just to find out that the replacement is just as bad as the original. I have to control the device with the joystick which isn't much better than the remote control. I do not at all recommend this product. it is way overpriced for the poor performance. I would advise looking into a cheaper product. Just because you pay more for something does not mean that you get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Chad C

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery quality
customer_reviews.text: The game controller's battery died. Not lasted even a year. Controller works as long as it is connected to USB. Tried many guides to troubleshoot a possible bug but no luck since it isn't a bug. The Shield itself is still a monster streaming machine or to play personal heavy 4K media files. The regular remote uses 2 coin batteries (crc2032 i think?) Which obviously will not last for months on everyday usage. Why did they discontinued the previous one with rechargeable battery? Because the quality of those internal batteries were bad? Nvidia you should really provide more quality on your peripheral accesories. Chinese knock off prove to be more reliable. And please talk to Netflix to provide ATMOS support!
customer_reviews.author: Dario Carles

customer_reviews.title: Great While It Worked
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Shield TV while it was working. Fast and lots of available apps. It was great until the day that I tried to use it and it was dead. Called nVidia for support, but since it was a little more than a year old they wouldn't help. All they said was go buy another one. Kind of crappy support. I understand that the warranty is only for 1 year. Mine died less than 16 months in. Very disappointed since I spent almost $200 for this and they say I should just go buy another. It would be another story if it was a $30 piece of equipment. Again, disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David Rosenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Skips frames when processing Netflix Video
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this device would have performed better than this. While watching Netflix, the video would sometimes slip frames and jump to catch up. I have both WiFi and Ethernet and a Fire TV that works perfectly as does my built in Netflix app on my Samsung TV. When I switched to my Samsung Netflix app, I immediately noticed a much better quality video. Even my Fire TV and Firesticks perform better than this. Very disappointed. Went to the Nvidia Shield forum and noticed many complaints about the missed frames dating back to last year.
customer_reviews.author: Flash Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Great device.....but now unreliable to say the least
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing TV streaming device in the market..... period. Very snappy and with tons of games available. It even comes with some great free oldies but goodies like the 2013 Tomb Raider and Spec Ops for free! Well worthy investment. A++. Edit: Lately this device has been having so many problems, from not being able to cast anything from my phone unless I'm using screen mirroring which automatically restricts Youtube and Google Play Movies when doing this. Also Google Play Movies app keeps giving errors when trying to play my library content. Has been very unreliable. I've been very dissapointed with Nvidia. These are all known issues but they haven't been doing anything to fix them.
customer_reviews.author: Wilfredo Rosario

customer_reviews.title: but the biggest problem is the remote it is terrible, I don't even use it anymore
customer_reviews.text: Not as fast as I thought it would be, but the biggest problem is the remote it is terrible, I don't even use it anymore, I use my old usb remote control, As far as download apps and using them it works very well. I would purchase this again but with a different remote. I plan on purchasing another remote control since I've had my current one for about 5 years, so if you buy this product get a remote or it will frustrate you.
customer_reviews.author: bigsteel

customer_reviews.title: Excuse the rant. One of the best streaming devices out there. Could be cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Great device to stream iptv. We pay enough on taxes to have to pay over 150$ a month to watch the liberal junk that 99 %of Hollywood has feeding us with lies to keep us divided so the others can swoop in and take the USA 🇺🇸 over. Man out forefathers are rolling in their graves. Anyway I would recommend this Nvidia Shield. Cut the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tindall

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced piece of ####
customer_reviews.text: Heard it was good from the reviews i read, that it was a good streaming device and that i could play games and stuff. Got it in the mail and tried to set it up. The Kodi wouldnt install correctly and kept giving me errors. Also it was advertised as 16gb but i checked and it was less than 11gb when i got it. all the games i got from the playstore ran so slow on it. Planning to return it and get a cheaper solution like Apple TV or chromecast. It would have been a better buy if it was under 100 dollars
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: So i got this thing to play emulators and have some streaming for my samsung tv at 4k without having any kind of hickups. Not only could it do the previous things mentioned, but given it has two usb out and an Ethernet port it will actually accept USB hubs so that you can add more media to it. My only true issue is the fact that sometimes google assistant will activate out of the blue... like i won't say google, and at the bottom of the screen it asks me what it can do for me... while pausing my movie. But when i do... assistant is on point... just wish it would search my vudu movies
customer_reviews.author: The Grim Panda

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Streaming Device!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many steaming players but the NVIDIA Shield is, by far, my favorite. Works great with Kodi and all of the other popular streaming apps and even includes Chrome Cast. It's very easy to setup, fast and integrates nicely with my Logitech Harmony Elite remote. This was a MUST do feature for me! Unboxed, plugged in and was off and running in 5 minutes. Kodi and my VPN apps installed with no issues. Kodi is a clean install and I am able to easily add my own add-ons with no issues. Yes, it costs a lot more than many of the other "Kodi Streaming Devices" available but was worth it. Made me a VERY happy person!
customer_reviews.author: KMack

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, Flexible, Good unit overall
customer_reviews.text: Out of all of the set top boxes I've used, I like the look and feel of the Shield. Aside from integration with other phones in the house, I like it more than my Apple TV. The only CON I can come up with is that it doesn't quite have enough horsepower to transcode videos recorded from my HD HomeRun.
customer_reviews.author: Myron

customer_reviews.title: I love love love my Shields
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 Nvidia Shields and I can't brag about them enough. We use them for streaming music, tv and movies and even playing video games (including Steam games). Perhaps my favorite thing is that Nvidia continues to update the operating system and other features. This is rather unique as most if not all manufacturer's only provide one or two updates prior to moving on to their next hardware. It's nice that the experience continues to get better long after you've purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: mahooga

customer_reviews.title: Best media player with only one real drawback
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. +4K Ultra HD support? Check +HDR support and auto colour space switching? Check +Dolby Atmos Passthrough? Check +HEVC playback of high bitrate 4K video files? Flawless +USB 3 ports +Gigabit ethernet +Voice control on remote works a treat with Google Assistant +Small, sleek looking device +Controller support (tested Xbox 360 controller with USB receiver) -Unfortunately does not support VP 9.2 so streaming HDR Youtube videos is not possible -Proprietary power supply plug -Remote lacks some buttons / gestures
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: This is the best invention ever
customer_reviews.text: So I have tried different android tv devises and was always unhappy with the interface and overall function. Then came the shield. This thing is amazing. We have been using it for over a year and it has become the hub for all our entertainment needs at home. Finally someone has taken the time to make something right. Could not be happier with this product. If your on the fence about whether or not its worth the $, my advise is buy it you wont be disappointed. Its fast, powerful and works flawlessly!!
customer_reviews.author: Nik C

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny for a cord cutter!
customer_reviews.text: There are a few different options for a device like this out there, but this one has such a zippy interface that it is no contest. Forget the Fire and Roku - this might be twice as much, but it is more than twice the device. Don't let the pictures fool you - it is actually quite small - much smaller than I imagined it to be. The game controller is great, and I like the remote's touch sensitive volume control (just slide your finger up and down the middle channel of the remote). After ditching cable TV, this was one of the most important pieces of the puzzle and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: After using it for about four months, I'd never buy another!
customer_reviews.text: Editing this first review! After four months and plenty of time to really use it, don't buy it, there many complaints about the updates. Their saying the complaints don't warrant a major change, but keep reading, crashing, freezing up, and having to restart TV apps even the subscription ones, are running rampant. I've loaded quite different boxes lately, this one is not worth the money at all. What I find really interesting is I bought a Jetstream from Walmart and though is doesn't look like a Nvidia, it operates exactly like one, it just doesnt have the storage, however, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Day

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device. Make sure to install the steam link ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device. Make sure to install the steam link app off the play store, it's waaay better and more flexible than the nvidia steam app that comes out of the box. Plenty of power to emulate older consoles too, and you can run them straight off of a NAS. Supports PLEX, which is a must. Supports Amazon Prime video app, as I understand it the only non-Amazon product that does so (at the time of this comment). Works well with a FLIRC device if you want a different remote than the one it comes with. I replaced a DIY HTPC with this, saving lots of electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phone App Remote is Great
customer_reviews.text: Fast. Super high quality streaming. Lots of free online games., although I bought it as my streaming device for PS Vue, Netflix, Prime. Easy to setup & works great. I have seen a lot of complaints about the remote control. Yes, it is not so hot for such a high quality device. BUT... the nVidia Phone App is a wonderful remote! Works through the wifi and so is not a line of site connection. With the Android or Apple App on your phone, there is nothing to complain about. Love this device!
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: The WiFi has been an issue.  Had to hard wire it.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for a year now and I want to smash the remote with a hammer!!! The audio slider is so sensitive it seems like a small breeze changes the volume while watching shows. WAY TOO ANNOYING! Streaming shows via WiFi has lots of macro-blocking. I had to pull twisted pair over there to use the Ethernet port to make it usable again. Prior to pulling the cable I had to go back and use my MiBox over WiFi as it had no issues streaming shows till we got the RV back home to fish the cable over there.
customer_reviews.author: BigBill

customer_reviews.title: Gen 2 is pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: Android TV all at it's best. really cannot say enough great things about this box. gaming, responsive tv streaming and just all around great little box. The only issues i have are not with the box itself, it's with Google Play or rather the lack of App's ported to the Android TV platform. do some research because alot of Android apps do not work at all on the Android TV platform. For those cord cutters out there. some of the best apps however are on Android TV. Sling, Playstation Vue, Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, DirectTV, YouTube and so on. Spectrum TV streaming is not though. They are on Android not Android TV
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: The Only Worthy Streaming Box
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This box is amazing...Blows the doors off everything else...ignore the the bad reviews, Im so glad I did. The remote works really nice, the streaming is awesome, great sound...very easy to use and KODI works great. Those bad reviews must be some bad boxes or bad wi-fi...because this box screams! Wish I would have bought this 8 months ago and saved myself buffering, lagging and other assorted problems with fire sticks and cheap boxes....Seriously folks, learn something about streaming, watch lots of youtube, find out how to do it right, you will find out that anyone who is a serious techno geek, will recommend the Shield. After finallly getting one, I have seen the light and it is Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tmanqz

customer_reviews.title: Great little Kodi box for all your 4K needs
customer_reviews.text: perfect little Kodi box. A little expensive compared to other Android boxes but this one is worth every penny. The only downfall is the remote in this version not being able to recharge. It ate through the battery in a just a few months, so I have purchased a new Bluetooth remote for it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Abney

customer_reviews.title: Updated Nvidia Shield the best
customer_reviews.text: Update 08/25/2020 After software update this is back at the top now, best of it's kind I am still taking off one star for the headaches it caused me before. This was bar none the best of the multitude of tv boxes and it was worth the high price. All was well until the last update, now I can not play videos for more than 4 minutes before the stream freezes and start buffering for ever. After the latest update I can't watch any video for more than 4 minutes, no youtube, no Amazon Prime, no personal videos, no Netflix, no Kodi, nothing... Do not buy, do not waste your money before this issue is resolved by Nividia.
customer_reviews.author: Acemicros

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game and tv box
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Nice remote, better than average gamepad. Great video res on tv, too. I'd buy this again. I just wish google would get their heads right with "Android TV", you know, the half-baked, half-fast version of android for use on tv's. A lot of stupid little issues.... some keyboards are flaky, some apps are useless, etc. I mean, just about any app is usable on Android TV, even if it's listed as "incompatible" on the play store but you have to find a site, download the APK then sideload the app onto the system. If you don't know what that means, google it. If you're not up for the hassle, buy a roku and an X-box.
customer_reviews.author: yenalsekim

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly with all the apps I use on it.
customer_reviews.text: I have replaced all my no named android boxes with the Shield TV. I feel the experience is worth the few extra dollars it costs. It is fast and responsive. I don't play games, so the fact the game controller did not come with it does not bother me at all. Any and all streaming apps are supported and work properly under the shield. I have had issues with the no name brands and their remotes not working properly with Netflix, Hulu and other streaming apps but no issues at all with the Shield TV. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Russell Timberman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Plex server
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have ever made, it has completely exceeds my expectations. I needed a reliable plex server to replace the one on my computer. I did not want to leave my computer on 24 hours a day, so the Shield was the perfect answer. I was going to use for a Plex server, but after using it for a few weeks I found that it was a great entertainment box. The options are endless. For games, I can't really make any comment because I do not play video games, however it is a very powerful machine. My only regret is that I wish that I had purchased the Pro version
customer_reviews.author: Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Over hyped paper weight
customer_reviews.text: Over rated papaer weight. Terrible interface, google play is incomplete, everything has to be sideloaded. Stay away. Use the firetv, much easier, this thing sucks. I was so excited to finally buy one and I hate it with a passion. I wish I could give it less than 1 star. Tried to tweak this thing for 2 days to get it to run right, apps dont show up, downloading is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: rod mcgallian

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer service known to man
customer_reviews.text: The unit has no on or off button, sometimes when it's off I can't get it to turn back on and I have to literally unplug the device. Customer service is absolutely horrible!! I've had my unit almost two years and customer service have not helped me wants to resolve any of my issues. when I use my remote to turn the unit off it comes back on many times while I'm on vacation ( away from home) the unit comes on and start playing videos from YouTube. I have complained over and over to Nivea shield and they do absolutely nothing...they pretend to write all my information and complaints down but never follow up.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Green Mean Streaming Machine
customer_reviews.text: Beats every other streaming device out of the water. As long as you have good WiFi connection or hardwired this device will stream anything you throw at it (IPTV, Netflix, ESPN, HBO, Terrarium, Kodi, etc). Also plays games very well. Haven't noticed a single lag or glitch using it. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Be aware, Nvidia doesn't want to honor it's warranty. Poor quality remote.
customer_reviews.text: My remote died within 3(three!) months, Nvidia USA won't ship me a new one unless I ship them the faulty first(good thing with trust issues to someone who buys Nvidia cards since Riva TNT, guys!). Nvidia office in my current country won't do anything to help me. I have a similar remote from Apple TV with SEVEN years and it still works. Guess I know which brand of video card and set top box to buy next time. TL;DR: Stay away from this brand. If you get a bad apple, they simply don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Luiz M

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market!
customer_reviews.text: After my Nexus Player died from a faulty update, I was forced to find a new streaming player. I own a Roku TV, an Apple TV, and have a small Mediacenter PC, but by far the most used player I own is my Nexus Player. The remote is high quality and the battery does not die. The connectivity is perfect. The gaming features are a nice bonus, and play at a surprisingly high quality when I plug in a keyboard. This is the best streaming player on the market, without question. I would recommend to anyone, no matter what brands you use for your other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Schram

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and very few issues to report after a couple months of use. Ive had a few android boxes before and this is by far and away the best android box or computer/box of any kind on the market today. You cant and wont be able to do better anytime this yr so might as well buy it. Not to mention this is soooo often reviewed or revised for upgrades, builds, games, downloads etc etc etc that there is just so much info out there to make this box whatever you want it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Love the Shield
customer_reviews.text: I know there are other smart devices like Roku, Firestick, etc however I like she Shield for other reasons. You can load your Android apps (even if it isn't in the Google Store, there is a way). Even though I have a NAS for Plex, it will take external USB storage and function as a Plex server. I tried it once and if you want this just to be a Plex server, make sure your content is native and doesn't require transcoding. It doesnt have an i7 proc by any means. Chromecast works as expected and I don't game with it much but the times I have, it has been enjoyable. A lot of power in a small package. Reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Truely one of the better purchases I have made. I got this for my mother who was using a Roku. It is just as simple as the Roku but far more powerful I set up a PLEX server on it and she can still watch her Netflix and Amazon shows. I love that I can use it as a Chromecast and occasionally pull up games to play while waiting on deliveries or repairmen. Did I mention the PLEX server because I use my HD Home Run to DVR shows for her. A external hard drive and a Sillicon Dust HD Home Run and now she never misses a show and she doesn't have to ffool with the cable box!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very highly recommended for a media type PC!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pure badass. It is almost a complete replacement for my Windows 7 PC itself. There are still just some things that Android OS cant do as good as Windows OS or maybe just not even compatible. And that is my only reasoning for keeping my PC around. This thing is blazing fast, low power and can literally do so many things and have yet to discover them all. To anyone looking for a "media type PC", i would highly recommend one of these! Side loading apps is very easy as well, anyone can do it!
customer_reviews.author: KingChoup17

customer_reviews.title: Best Streaming Box I Own
customer_reviews.text: I cut the chord 3 years ago, and I live off OTA and streaming content. I own a firestick, Kpro and beelink android box, and they are all good. However the Shield is hands down the fastest box I own. However I do have one gripe. It does not have the full android market like my phone or tablet. You have to sideload certain apps you want, but it has most of the ones you want. That's the only think keeping it from 5 stars, but its a great box. Very pricy but looks like its getting cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Old Man Muscles

customer_reviews.title: We love our Shield!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, we love it! We use it for Plex, Kodi, games, and will probably be subscribing to a IPTV provider as well. Even my wife the technophobe think's it's great and uses it daily, so that's really saying something.The remote is complete and utter garbage however, try not to throw it at anything, it's fairly hefty. Overall ten stars for the device, minus five for the remote. Buy a Shield without it, save yourself an aneurysm, and pick up pretty much any other real remote in existence.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Only minor problem is the remote will go to sleep and needs to wake up. I replaced the battery and seems to continue. If you are watching a movie and your halfway through and want to adjust the volume. You have to press the volume a few times then it wakes up and works. I have used this for over a year. Stream quality is awesome the hardware does not feel like it slows down it is very responsive. Casting works as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming device period
customer_reviews.text: 10x the flexibility and quality of appletv, roku or amazon(sorry guys). It's the only Android device in my home. Unless youre dedicated to the apple or amazon ecosystem it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: spalmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I was initially unsure if I should buy a shield. It’s very expensive. But after owning it nearly a year I am very very happy with it. The built-in chromecast is really convenient to have, although some smartTVs have this. The user interface is very responsive. So much to the point where I stopped using my smartTV’s built in apps in favor of exclusively using the shield. Playing games on this thing is pretty great. You really can’t get as precise as a mouse & keyboard but this is great for casual games. Overall I’m pleased
customer_reviews.author: Zach G

customer_reviews.title: Can no longer recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have truly enjoyed my nvidia shield until recently. I have two units (purchased about 2-3 months apart) and both game controllers have gone bad. The right joystick on both is malfunctioning and the games just spin when I try to play. While I understand that things can happen, having two go bad in such a short period of time is not acceptable. After doing some research I found several people have had this exact issue with their controllers. As a media/streaming device it is a solid choice but I'd have to recommend staying away from the gaming version.
customer_reviews.author: T. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming machine for hdr 4k
customer_reviews.text: It’s a beast with built in chromecast. it capable to stream 4k hdr 10 bit video signals from network or attached usb storage. The quality of the video in fantastic. You can install on it Kodi for android and run it smoothly. for it’s price i prefer the shield over a pc. It’s very quit (noisless). You can control the shield via logitech harmony hub based remote. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Loui

customer_reviews.title: Supposed to be the best
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple Amazon Firesticks when I was looking to cut the cable. They're really good products and you can learn how to "Program" the sticks or any android device. The nVidia Shield was put up as the best streaming device for my purposes. I'm, not sure it's any better than an Amazon Firestick 4k or a Firebox but it has a good bit of RAM and works great. We're now completely out of the pockets of the TV/Landline provider and that $247 a month bill, hardwired into our router by ethernet cable and receiving 6000 channels for 10% of the price we were paying for stuff we didn't watch. The Shield is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ol' Reg

customer_reviews.title: Why bother with the game controller?
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I like this unit. I've had several video streaming boxes from proprietary to generic android/kodi boxes. I bought this one because it was best in class. I like the gaming controller thing. I was first impressed by it's heft. But, gaming on this thing, at least for me, is no good. Granted, I haven't tried much... but every time I try to use this controller, it's dead and needs a recharge. The remote works fine, but has limited functionality. It works fine for most purposes, but I added a USB RII keyboard for full functionality. I'd buy this device again, but without the game controller.
customer_reviews.author: J. Korst

customer_reviews.title: Do you use Plex? This is the best option for you.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to run a Plex server on this device, this is a great option. Do you just want to use this as a Plex client? This is the best device you could buy for that purpose. While the remote might not be as good as the new 2019 model, I really love the performance and constant support NVIDIA has poured into this product line. The UI is snappy and the amount of available applications is great thanks to Android. If you weren't aware, it has Chromecast Built-In so you can cast your desktop/laptop to it as well as any compatible mobile apps.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Robb

customer_reviews.title: Too late, . .
customer_reviews.text: The screen froze because the remote died. I replaced the batteries as recommended (although those batteries should last for 5 years!) Then asked my grandson, who also has the same Nvidia Shield and actually recommended it to me. He could not get it to sync, either with my Shield box or his. Now, as others have stated, the window for return or replacement closed 2 days ago, and I cannot find any way to contact the manufacturer. So what am I to do? Eat the $170? Got to leave a bad review. . .
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best set top box I have used. Extremely responsive. Intuitive interface. Handy remote. I don't really game on it much, but I was able to stream Fallout 4 and GTA V from my PC without issues. Xbox One controller hooked right up and off I went. Most use it for Netflix and Plex, which it excels at. Waaaaaaay better than the crap software in my Sony TV.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Shultz

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Droid box ever
customer_reviews.text: Greatest Droid box ever. Remotes work with no lag. Installed TerrariumTV and works flawless. I signed up for Nvidia Now for 7.99/mo and played the games available to stream for free. A decent selection. The fastest Droid box on the market as far as hardware goes. Make sure you're connected with Ethernet as streaming through wifi, even at 5 gigs, is a bit laggy. A little pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: pheng

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming device out there!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about the Shield. The interface is uncluttered and responsive. The voice controls are surprisingly useful for searching for content. The Shield natively supports the widest range of audio and video file types and codecs. Being able to cast video from a phone to the Shield comes in handy and having the Google Assistant built-in to the Shield is a bonus! I have used numerous other streaming devices but this is easily my favorite. I haven't tried any of the gaming functionality - I'm just using it for Plex, Netflix, YouTube, Spotify, and Amazon video.
customer_reviews.author: Stitch.626

customer_reviews.title: Really great but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: What are you doing with this? Are you watching streaming media? You'll love it...but the tiny remote will frustrate you. The newer Toblerone-looking remote is much better. Go to their website and order one (amazon has scalpers charging ridiculous amounts). Are you gaming? It's super easy to connect and play, but the pack-in controller is hardly top of the line. Are you retro gaming? You can install lots of emulators, though I'd stick with retroarch for convenience. That being said, nothing past the 16 bit era is perfect. A lot of slowdown persists. It doesn't do anything 100% but it does everything between 85%-95%. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth audio : an added bonus
customer_reviews.text: The built-in android OS and the included remote are much more responsive than my smart TV. This is an excellent buy. The Shield TV also supports all Bluetooth audio formats (including aptx HD and Ldac) with the new Android OS, simply enable the developer option to choose the audio format you want. Furthermore, Apps such as Netflix and YouTube seem able to automatically delay video playback, so that the audio and video are perfectly synced over Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Yen

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best streaming device on the market
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this device. Plex, Netflix, Amazon etc just work very well. Plex direct plays everything. There is no other device with as wide a range of codec support. My only gripe is the remote is awful. I use a Logitech harmony that works perfectly with the Shield but should not have had to buy a different remote to get one that functions well. Especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Snappy Box For Streaming From Apps and Built-in Google Chromecast
customer_reviews.text: NVIDIA Shield is super fast and reliable. I believe in this product and the company. It is easy to use and I was able to download my apps and streaming services but some came pre-loaded. I also love how google chromecast is built in, so I can easily stream from my phone or computer I have tried a bunch of android boxes and this is by far the snappiest and quickest to load. It is reliable too. I haven't had any issues with streaming with this box. I like the small remote but also have the qwerty keyboard which I recommend to make it easier to search items.
customer_reviews.author: philephan81

customer_reviews.title: Great Streaming box.
customer_reviews.text: Great streaming box. I mostly use it for Streaming My DVDs over my network to my TV. It does a great job of that. I started to use it with my Kids to play games with. It does work well for that. It is a bit short on support when it comes to android apps. My security cameras manufacture does not have an app for this box unfortunately. I have been able to make a work around. It would just be nice to have the same app here as well. I am sure it is coming.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Stacey Tew

customer_reviews.title: Solid Android TV Steaming Player
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Shield TV to replace an older CuBox i4 Pro android device running android 4.4.4 OS which was not supported by current versions of most streaming video apps (Netflix, Hulu, Sling). The Shield was easy to setup, navigate and customize via sideloading apps not supported in the Google Play Store. My only minor gripe is the user interface which doesn't allow some/all sideloaded apps to show on the Home screen...minor. Performance is excellent either wired or wireless....the built-in ethernet connection is appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: BillB

customer_reviews.title: It's Great, but for the price...
customer_reviews.text: Yeah I love it so far, but my sanity brought me back to earth, and probably buyer remorse kicked in.. For me just for watching movies, and downloader App and k0di this feel like a overkill.. I got a a new firestick 4k for my store and it seem to work just fine, def better than their first gen .... i haven't event try the gaming option on this yet on this, because everytime i play game it usually on a PC or a handheld console. might return for another Firestick 4k.. it not that i'm not happy with the product... it just there a 40 dollar stick that can do basically the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: UE

customer_reviews.title: Best Streaming Device !
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews and getting fed up with my other TV streaming devices, I finally bought one of these. It took me years to get one since I am not a gamer and wouldn't have use for the gaming controller. I just like crisp clear non-buffering movies ,fast loading YouTube videos ,with the Nvidia Shield I get that and more. A little time watching "How to use Nivida Shield" YouTube videos ,I found a lot more content to watch. I love it so much I'm buying a 4k monitor to hook up to it. Bye, Bye TV and cable.
customer_reviews.author: Fly Robin

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a big upgrade from my blueray streaming device. You can download the latest apps. the menu is easy to use and fast and the unit is nice and small. The gaming I haven't used yet waiting till the winter months to try that. Only issue is the size of the remote not great for man hands and slippery. But, I like that has less buttons. But, don't the up/down, left/right aren't separate buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: They hype is true!  Get one!
customer_reviews.text: I took a long time researching what media player to get and I am really happy I settled on this one! Having bought it during the holiday sale, I have no regrets to getting it. It just works! I eventually decided to purchase additional memory so got the Patriot 128GB SSD stick and it further enhanced my storage options! I'm glad I took time to research and watch those YouTube videos as it helped me make the right decision. I am now using it with Flex and my HD Homerun Prime as my media center.
customer_reviews.author: what's up doc?

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny.
customer_reviews.text: Really can not recommend this more. For anyone from the most basic user, to the uber geek (me) this does just about everything. Most powerful/versatile box of its type that I can find. Android always has some quirks/occasional crashes, but I suspect that is generally when I'm pushing it's limits. In retrospect I wish I had gotten the controller! Just do yourself a favor and get it bundled, if you hate it you can sell it to a sucker like me. Works great for emulators with some setup. Dolphin runs surprisingly smoothly for GameCube at least.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, the best home entertainment device
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing a month now. I love it. It can do everything, and it does it well. The GUI is fast. Running netflix and other common streaming apps it never slows down. Plex server capable so I can watch my digital stored movies anywhere. It can play just about any new game. Has several games included. It can run Retro Arc and other emulators as well. Supports bluetooth or usb controllers. I will probably end up buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great unit.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We have had it for one week. We have also had a number of media players. Including a WDTV box and a fire TV stick. This media player is in another league. It's fast and after loading a Archos App I couldn't be happier. We use an external drive on our netgear router modem to watch some content via WIFI. It never skips a beat. Picture and sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kachuck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent HIFI streamer, Video streamer & Gaming console in one
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my USB DAC. When watching movies or gaming it plays audio through the HDMI. When I turn on the USB DAC, it automatically switches over to USB 24/192 audio which is perfect for HIFI audio streaming. It has like 72 video modes. So I can dial in my 4K display to the optimal setting. Oh and the gaming feature alone is reason enough to buy this. 4K at 60Hz. Paired with a low latency display and a surround audio system, this is perfect for the gamer in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Where's the friggin' on/off switch !!??
customer_reviews.text: It's the friggin' Nvidia shield !! It's the king and there's a reason !! My one gripe where's the damn on/off switch ?? Not there anymore !! Only on the PRO model . I know how to turn off in the system , but you have to disconnect the power cable and plug in again to power on . Sleep mode isn't off switch, it's more of a standby . The switch thing is stupid though .you do need to power off unit , not designed to stay on !! Nvidia needs its ass kicked for this decision !!
customer_reviews.author: Herbert H.

customer_reviews.title: Great TV/Gaming Device
customer_reviews.text: Great item, upgraded from firestick and i absolutely love it, faster, more convenient to use and have for more tv content plus the gaming experience is way better, also able to add all the additional storage i want for more apps, movie and gaming storage
customer_reviews.author: Jondmon

customer_reviews.title: Superior
customer_reviews.text: Struggle to find one thing that would make me unhappy. Sync with android phone worked like a clock. Casting PC desktop on TV went with zero issues, no noticeable latency. Same with casting a separate game. GeForce now works shockingly great (experience depends on you IPS, router, location). Both wireless keyboard and mouse got recognized and worked great. I was able to resolve all quirks (shield refusing to release control over sound system back to PC) with a couple of clicks. I hope longevity of all the functions will also be great. But right now I couldn't be happier. Excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent streamer, game and media box
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than what i had imagined. It took about 15mins to get it initially setup through Google. I haven't played any of the Free Shield games yet but my 8year old had no problems playing so far. I did watch a show from Netflix but did not try Amazon Prime video yet. It comes standard with Youtube, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu and a few others right out the box. It also allows you to link it to other accounts like Pandora, Spotifiy(these two come with it as well), Tunein and others.
customer_reviews.author: bigqdone

customer_reviews.title: Proprietary power adapter, DON'T BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough as a slingbox, but is quite a bit more expensive than most others. The distinguishing feature is the Geforce NOW support, but generally I've found that to be far too laggy to be enjoyable. Even single player games like turn-based RTSs or JPRGs are close to 500ms lag time round trip. Do yourself a favor and just get a chromecast ultra instead, it's much cheaper and much better. Also the power adapter started buzzing after a few months of normal use, and I can't find a replacement anywhere. It's proprietary even though it looks just like a usb-c.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Quite abysmal performance for a "top of the line" TV box, also got "fined" by Amazon for this
customer_reviews.text: Tried this since supposedly it's the best Android TV box by far, but as high were the expectations, so was the disappointment. The thing got stuck quite often, the apps would crash, and it even was shutting down by itself. And to top it all off, Amazon "fined" me with restocking and shipping fees for this defective product, even though I mailed it out while the return window was still open. What can I do that I don't control how fast the postal carriers operate?! Can't say I recommend anything about the Shield, nor was Amazon's customer service any good (on the chat they assured me "meh, tough luck" basically). Very disappointing :/
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kolesnik

customer_reviews.title: King!
customer_reviews.text: I have to start off by saying this is the king of android devices. Take it from someone who has purchased and tested multiple android boxes from amazon. Everything from fast voice recognition, extremely responsive, beautiful layout, the game and regular remote, plus the ability to be used as a plex server is what sets it apart from the rest. That alone in my opinion makes it a clear winner. Videos play smooth in 4K and plex reads files of a external hdd fast and smooth. I would buy it again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: RealizeGFX

customer_reviews.title: Great Plex Server
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one purpose: to act as a dedicated Plex Server. It works great! I connected it directly to my router with Cat8 Ethernet cable and connected it to a television for initial setup. After getting it set up (and turning on the Plex Server), I disconnected it from the television and moved it to the basement near my router. It’s been working great! I attached a 1TB hard drive via USB for storage and I can access that drive via my home network to manage media that the server serves. It’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, but android tv is bechine the times ...
customer_reviews.text: Great hardware, but android tv is bechine the times and not getting the attention is needs to compete. Example, as of Dec2017 the Hulu app is not updated to support profiles. Also the remote is a little weird, the touch volume works ok for the android tv but if you set it up to control the tv (ir) it was super hot and miss on every tv I tried. Using it as a plex server worked but it wasn’t as easy to manage and a deadicqted computer running plex server. I’ll stick to my Roku devices for now.
customer_reviews.author: SS6

customer_reviews.title: Don't plan on using two USB drives.
customer_reviews.text: The USB ports are too close together, making finding two drives that fit difficult. The internal storage is too small, and the price for the pro version doesn't seem to justify the upgrade. Other than that, I like it. Streams everything fine, played NES and SNES games fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype, over priced
customer_reviews.text: There is no reason this is $140, the quality of local MKV files are very washed out, I'm not a noob just writing this because I don't know what I'm doing. I extensively tried to troubleshoot why MKV files were looking washed out and greyish. I tried to tweak settings, bypassed my receiver and tried other monitors and another TV. My decade old Boxee Box outputs better black levels than this! It's really not worth it and I'm very disappointed because it's a pretty cool product.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Jon

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming box 3 yrs running!
customer_reviews.text: The best streaming box made, the retro game emulation is tops! I have one in every room and just sent one to my brother as a birthday present!
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Streamer!!! 5'o el star'o!!!
customer_reviews.text: This device is great! Works great! Apps work great! I did have a problem with my remote, where it would take 2 or 3 clicks to go right but only one click to go left. Chatted with tech support and they OVERNIGHT'ED me a replacement remote! NVIDIA has awesome tech support. I use this primarily for streaming Netflix, YouTube, Pluto and Playstation Vue; all of which it does AWESOME! I play a couple games on it and haven't had any issues there either! The Google Play Store has been really restricted for this device, which yeah it sucks not being able to download everything, but everything you can download is guaranteed to work!
customer_reviews.author: William Docter

customer_reviews.title: True Android TV Experience For Cord Cutters
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this is the Cadillac of android boxes. Nothing comes even close. Powerful processor with a good amount of on board memory with an expansion slots to add more. Easy to install. Sleek design. Easy to navigate menu screen. Can sideload almost any app including Kodi. Movies, TV shows, Games, all most anything you can think of. I'm loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Walt O.

customer_reviews.title: Save up an extra fifty bucks and get the best of the best
customer_reviews.text: This was my first TV box for streaming. I didn't know what to expect, I didn't have anything to compare it to, I just watched the reviews and bought the Box. This thing could not be easier to use you get great setup help the quality of each function is spot-on. After purchasing this box, I decided to try and get a cheaper box for my bedroom just to have a streamer in the bedroom. That box compared to this box is absolutely trash. If you can get this box get this box.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Still the Best Android TV Box
customer_reviews.text: If money is no object this is the Android TV box of your dreams. Simply works, user friendly GUI even for little kids and voice recognition is just the icing on the cake. 4K streaming on Netflix and Google, not sure about Prime but I would assume so...I just haven't tested it. Despite it's age it is still the best there is, trust me. If you game and want to stream from your PC it's a good option as well.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Geek

customer_reviews.title: Nice Streaming Device
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to navigate this interface. My husband loves it, we've loaded all our streaming services on this. Haven't used it for any games tho. The voice recognition has failed on us, but I think that's due to user error and not the unit itself, since we had a toddler get ahold of the remote and... let's say it was tossed the remote like a frisbee across the room. Remote is durable, we haven't replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Rolls Royce of Streaming Machines
customer_reviews.text: This is the Rolls Royce of Streaming Machines. I've replaced my Fire Stick, Roku and Tivo (dropped the $14/ monthly service fee) with Nvidia Shield. HD Homerun and Plex work flawlessly. The Player is perfect for Kodi users and gamers. It's the perfect machine for cord cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Influence52

customer_reviews.title: yes this is gaming andoid box but have 1 problem
customer_reviews.text: the problem is limit to use android apps a lot of game from android not compatible like pubg mobile , crossfire legend mobile i did try a lot of way to work the game like put keyboard mouse all apps for working the mouse keyboard inside the game is not working so im surrender to use that... about the nvidia game you need so faster internet to play the other pc game.. i feel that device is designed for microsoft and streaming video only ..
customer_reviews.author: Rence

customer_reviews.title: the Cadillac of streamers
customer_reviews.text: I read all the hype on this gaming/streamer and was tired of the issues I had experienced with cheap Chinese boxes.... haven't looked back as it never has an issue...though I haven't tried the gaming capabilities yet. Bought it on sale and did the amazon credit card which knocked off half the price!! cha-ching. I would definitely recommend the Nvidia Shield
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Best streaming device on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best streaming device. Nvidia just updated it to Android 9. I have this and the Fire TV 4k, both are great but the Shield does not have any lag at all. The software is kept up to date and it runs Android TV, so lots of apps from the google play store.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: Not going to lie this piece of tech is pretty sweet. Tons of features and a cool design. I only gave it 4 stars as a whole because the actually build of the device is made of really cheap plastic. I feel at this stage of the game they should of made a light metal casing or something more durable then what it is. My only other gripe is the interface and navigation. I wasn’t wowed at all. Super basic while still being cluttered. I still recommend you buy it just don’t drop it, touch it, look at it wrong, let the dog get it or kids.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use Home Theater/Gaming System
customer_reviews.text: As most of the reviews have mentioned, this system is definitely worth it. Upgraded from a Chromecast to the Nvidia Shield and do not regret it. The small remote that comes with the Shield is a bit finicky, and I end up using the controller most of the time. Nvidia GameStream works flawlessly, but make sure to have the Shield hardwired to the router. The current setup that works right now is PC > Ethernet > GoogleWifi Hub > Wireless Mesh Backplane > GoogleWifiHub > Ethernet > Shield. This provides a stable connection for 1080p 60fps streaming. Connecting through WiFi only will make the Shield only choose 2.4GHz if using a GoogleWifi network.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted in a streaming device.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted in a streaming device. It is very snappy. It works perfectly with the Harmony Hub. Google Assistant has some cool features that give it a slight edge over the Google Home when watching TV (on-screen summaries, weather forecast, etc.). Having chromecast built in is HUGE - Comcast doesn't allow users to sign into their accounts when using the Android TV HBOGO app. BUT they do allow logins from android devices. So I'm able to cast from my android to my TV as a workaround. I've set up a couple emulators using RetroArch which is really fun. Finally, the NVidia gamestream works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Chad M

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: It worked when we first got it, but really lags even when connected to Ethernet. Never had this much trouble with the Roku for streaming tv even over the Wi-Fi. Tried to do some gaming but it’s not even wanting to game with this Ethernet. Called support twice and they said they were going to get back with me. Never had. I’d as soon as get my money back and purchase another Roku for the main tv.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up on a deal with a great price. Works well, you can easily root the thing and set up all the apps you want. Turned off the bloatware. Puts out a very nice picture - streams well. Lots of games that you don't have to log into GeForce if you don't want to. The only annoying thing is that it want's to link me to some Google leaderboard and keeps asking me to log in, but it's not the worst thing since I can skip that nonsense. The minute I can't, I'll put a different OS on it and run some emulators.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: A perfect package for media and gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a Plex server. Wow this is a gaming device too.. who knew? Amazing how awesome and compact this device is and never knew it existed until I went to plex.tv to look for a hardware solution. Amazed they do not advertise this more. It seems to do everything. Works perfectly for me as a media server / game console. Amazing. One note: 16GB is not enough internal space. You will need to expand internal memory with USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Best out there for streaming
customer_reviews.text: I've used pretty much every streaming device and finally bit the bullet and paid the premium cost for the Shield. It is much smoother than any other device, and being able to sideload any Android app is great. My only complaint, like many, I really don't like the remote. I use it mainly to stream from my computer with Plex and to watch other streaming services and it works great. I play the occasional game on it (mostly as an emulator) but games are not a priority for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: Good system. Runs Kodi well
customer_reviews.text: Good system. Runs Kodi well. Instead of making the new version smaller, I wish the would have upped the Specs with more Ram and a better processor than the orignal. I also Hate the fact that I can't turn it off. There are a kit cheaper options out there, But what it does it does well!
customer_reviews.author: cetrax

customer_reviews.title: Worst remote control ever.
customer_reviews.text: Besides having what might be the worst, most annoying and battery draining piece of crap remote control, everything else is absolutely perfect. Easy to use, doesn't have as many apps as the fire tv, and it's lacking things like the discovery channel and science channel go apps, but since it's also a chromecast it's easy enough to just cast it to the device. It seems to struggle sometimes keeping the video and audio in sync. Doesn't happen everywhere or all the time, and that could very well be the fault of the app itself.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great device didn't last long...
customer_reviews.text: I have had the device for 3 months and it has failed already. I love the device and its options are perfect for us. Now for the bad 3 months and now it won't turn on? Not good two stars taken away. Contacted support and they have shipped a "new" one to me took about a week or so. One star returned. But have not received a return shipping label yet so still waiting on that. Hope this one lasts longer than the last one.
customer_reviews.author: James C.
